verses.verse: And all the congregation<WH5712> lifted up<WH5375> their voice<WH6963>, and cried<WH5414>; and the people<WH5971> wept<WH1058> that night<WH3915>.

And all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> murmured<WH3885> against Moses<WH4872> and against Aaron<WH175>: and the whole congregation<WH5712> said<WH559> unto them<WH3863>, Would that we had died<WH4191> in the land<WH776> of Egypt<WH4714>! or would<WH3863> that we had died<WH4191> in this wilderness<WH4057>!

And wherefore doth Jehovah<WH3068> bring<WH935> us unto this land<WH776>, to fall<WH5307> by the sword<WH2719>? Our wives<WH802> and our little ones<WH2945> will be a prey<WH957>: were it not better<WH2896> for us to return<WH7725> into Egypt<WH4714>?
And they said<WH559> one<WH376> to another<WH251>, Let us make<WH5414> a captain<WH7218>, and let us return<WH7725> into Egypt<WH4714>.
Then Moses<WH4872> and Aaron<WH175> fell<WH5307> on their faces<WH6440> before<WH6440> all the assembly<WH6951> of the congregation<WH5712> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.
And Joshua<WH3091> the son<WH1121> of Nun<WH5126> and Caleb<WH3612> the son<WH1121> of Jephunneh<WH3312>, who were of them that spied<WH8446> out the land<WH776>, rent<WH7167> their clothes<WH899>:

and they spake<WH559> unto all the congregation<WH5712> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, saying<WH559>, The land<WH776>, which we passed<WH5674> through to spy<WH8446> it out<WH3966>, is an exceeding good<WH2896> land<WH776>.
If Jehovah<WH3068> delight<WH2654> in us<WH935>, then he will bring us into this land<WH776>, and give<WH5414> it unto us<WH776>; a land which floweth<WH2100> with milk<WH2461> and honey<WH1706>.

Only rebel<WH4775> not against Jehovah<WH3068>, neither fear<WH3372> ye the people<WH5971> of the land<WH776>; for they are bread<WH3899> for us<WH6738>: their defence is removed<WH5493> from over them<WH3068>, and Jehovah is with us<WH3372>: fear them not.

But all the congregation<WH5712> bade<WH559> stone<WH7275> them with stones<WH68>. And the glory<WH3519> of Jehovah<WH3068> appeared<WH7200> in the tent<WH168> of meeting<WH4150> unto all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>.

And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559> unto Moses<WH4872>, How long will this people<WH5971> despise<WH5006> me<WH3808>? and how long will they not believe<WH539> in me<WH226>, for all the signs which I have wrought<WH6213> among them<WH7130>?
I will smite<WH5221> them with the pestilence<WH1698>, and disinherit<WH3423> them<WH6213>, and will make of thee a nation<WH1471> greater<WH1419> and mightier than they<WH6099>.
And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, Then the Egyptians<WH4714> will hear<WH8085> it<WH5927>; for thou broughtest up this people<WH5971> in thy might<WH3581> from among them<WH7130>;

and they will tell<WH559> it to the inhabitants<WH3427> of this land<WH776>. They have heard<WH8085> that thou Jehovah<WH3068> art in the midst<WH7130> of this people<WH5971>; for thou Jehovah<WH3068> art seen<WH7200> face<WH5869> to face<WH5869>, and thy cloud<WH6051> standeth<WH5975> over them<WH1980>, and thou goest before<WH6440> them<WH5982>, in a pillar of cloud<WH6051> by day<WH3119>, and in a pillar<WH5982> of fire<WH784> by night<WH3915>.
Now if thou shalt kill<WH4191> this people<WH5971> as one<WH259> man<WH376>, then the nations<WH1471> which have heard<WH8085> the fame<WH8088> of thee will speak<WH559>, saying<WH559>,

Because Jehovah<WH3068> was not<WH1115> able<WH3201> to bring<WH935> this people<WH5971> into the land<WH776> which he sware<WH7650> unto them<WH7819>, therefore he hath slain them in the wilderness<WH4057>.
And now<WH3581>, I pray thee, let the power of the Lord<WH136> be great<WH1431>, according<WH834> as thou hast spoken<WH1696>, saying<WH559>,

Jehovah <WH3068> is slow to anger<WH750>, and abundant<WH7227> in lovingkindness<WH2617>, forgiving<WH5375> iniquity<WH5771> and transgression<WH6588>; and that will by no means<WH5352> clear<WH5352> the guilty<WH6485>, visiting the iniquity<WH5771> of the fathers<WH1> upon the children<WH1121>, upon the third<WH8029> and upon the fourth generation<WH7256>.

Pardon <WH5545>, I pray thee<WH5771>, the iniquity of this people<WH5971> according unto the greatness<WH1433> of thy lovingkindness<WH2617>, and according as thou hast forgiven<WH5375> this people<WH5971>, from Egypt<WH4714> even until now<WH2008>.
And Jehovah<WH3068> said<WH559>, I have pardoned<WH5545> according to thy word<WH1697>:
but in very deed<WH199>, as I live<WH2416>, and as all the earth<WH776> shall be filled<WH4390> with the glory<WH3519> of Jehovah<WH3068>;

because all those men<WH582> that have seen<WH7200> my glory<WH3519>, and my signs<WH226>, which I wrought<WH6213> in Egypt<WH4714> and in the wilderness<WH4057>, yet have tempted<WH5254> me these ten<WH6235> times<WH6471>, and have not hearkened<WH8085> to my voice<WH6963>;
surely they shall not<WH518> see<WH7200> the land<WH776> which I sware<WH7650> unto their fathers<WH1>, neither shall any of them that despised<WH5006> me see it<WH7200>:

but my servant<WH5650> Caleb<WH3612>, because<WH6118> he had another<WH312> spirit<WH7307> with him<WH310>, and hath followed me fully<WH4390>, him will I bring<WH935> into the land<WH776> whereinto he went<WH935>; and his seed<WH2233> shall possess it<WH3423>.

Now the Amalekite<WH6003> and the Canaanite<WH3669> dwell<WH3427> in the valley<WH6010>: to-morrow<WH4279> turn<WH6437> ye<WH5265>, and get you into the wilderness<WH4057> by the way<WH1870> to the Red<WH5488> Sea<WH3220>.
And Jehovah<WH3068> spake<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872> and unto Aaron<WH175>, saying<WH559>,

How long shall I bear with this evil<WH7451> congregation<WH5712>, that murmur<WH3885> against me<WH8085>? I have heard the murmurings<WH8519> of the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, which they murmur against me<WH3885>.
Say <WH559> unto them<WH2416>, As I live, saith<WH5002> Jehovah<WH3068>, surely as<WH3808> ye have spoken<WH1696> in mine ears<WH241>, so will I do to you<WH6213>:

your dead bodies<WH6297> shall fall<WH5307> in this wilderness<WH4057>; and all that were numbered<WH6485> of you<WH4557>, according to your whole number, from twenty<WH6242> years<WH8141> old<WH1121> and upward<WH4605>, that have murmured against me<WH3885>,

surely ye shall not<WH518> come<WH935> into the land<WH776>, concerning which I sware<WH3027> that I would make you dwell<WH7931> therein<WH3612>, save Caleb the son<WH1121> of Jephunneh<WH3312>, and Joshua<WH3091> the son<WH1121> of Nun<WH5126>.
But your little ones<WH2945>, that ye said<WH559> should be a prey<WH957>, them will I bring in<WH935>, and they shall know<WH3045> the land<WH776> which ye have rejected<WH3988>.
But as for you<WH6297>, your dead bodies shall fall<WH5307> in this wilderness<WH4057>.

And your children<WH1121> shall be wanderers<WH7462> in the wilderness<WH4057> forty<WH705> years<WH8141>, and shall bear<WH5375> your whoredoms<WH2184>, until your dead bodies<WH6297> be consumed<WH8552> in the wilderness<WH4057>.

After the number<WH4557> of the days<WH3117> in which ye spied<WH8446> out the land<WH776>, even forty<WH705> days<WH3117>, for every day<WH3117> a year<WH3117>, shall ye bear<WH5375> your iniquities<WH5771>, even forty<WH705> years<WH8141>, and ye shall know<WH3045> my alienation<WH8569>.

I <WH3068>, Jehovah, have spoken<WH1696>, surely<WH518> this will I do<WH6213> unto<WH2063> all this evil<WH7451> congregation<WH5712>, that are gathered together<WH3259> against me<WH4057>: in this wilderness they shall be consumed<WH8552>, and there they shall die<WH4191>.

And the men<WH582>, whom Moses<WH4872> sent<WH7971> to spy<WH8446> out the land<WH776>, who returned<WH7725>, and made all the congregation<WH5712> to murmur<WH3885> against him<WH3318>, by bringing up an evil report<WH1681> against the land<WH776>,
even those<WH582> men<WH582> that did bring up<WH3318> an evil<WH7451> report<WH1681> of the land<WH776>, died<WH4191> by the plague<WH4046> before<WH6440> Jehovah<WH3068>.

But Joshua<WH3091> the son<WH1121> of Nun<WH5126>, and Caleb<WH3612> the son<WH1121> of Jephunneh<WH3312>, remained alive<WH2421> of those men<WH1992> that went<WH1980> to spy<WH8446> out the land<WH776>.
And Moses<WH4872> told<WH1696> these words<WH1697> unto all the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>: and the people<WH5971> mourned<WH56> greatly<WH3966>.

And they rose up early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, and gat them up<WH5927> to the top<WH7218> of the mountain<WH2022>, saying<WH559>, Lo<WH2009>, we are here<WH5927>, and will go up unto the place<WH4725> which Jehovah<WH3068> hath promised<WH559>: for we have sinned<WH2398>.
And Moses<WH4872> said<WH559>, Wherefore now do ye transgress<WH5674> the commandment<WH6310> of Jehovah<WH3068>, seeing it shall not prosper<WH6743>?
Go not up<WH5927>, for Jehovah<WH3068> is not among<WH7130> you<WH5062>; that ye be not smitten down before<WH6440> your enemies<WH341>.

For there the Amalekite<WH6003> and the Canaanite<WH3669> are before<WH6440> you<WH5307>, and ye shall fall by the sword<WH2719>: because ye are turned<WH7725> back<WH310> from following Jehovah<WH3068>, therefore Jehovah will not be with you<WH3068>.

But they presumed<WH6075> to go up<WH5927> to the top<WH7218> of the mountain<WH2022>: nevertheless the ark<WH727> of the covenant<WH1285> of Jehovah<WH3068>, and Moses<WH4872>, departed<WH4185> not out<WH4185> of the camp<WH4264>.
Then the Amalekite<WH6003> came down<WH3381>, and the Canaanite<WH3669> who dwelt<WH3427> in that mountain<WH2022>, and smote<WH5221> them and beat<WH3807> them down<WH2767>, even unto Hormah.
